problem_text:
19.44. By definition a profinite group has finite rank at most r if every subgroup of it can be (topologically) generated by r elements. Suppose that for every element g of a profinite group G there is a closed subgroup Eg of finite rank such that for every x ∈ G all sufficiently long Engel commutators [x, g, . . . , g] belong to Eg, that is, for every x ∈ G there is a positive integer n(x, g) such that [x, g, . . . , g] ∈ Eg whenever g is repeated ⩾ n(x, g) times. Is it true that G has a normal subgroup N of finite rank with locally nilpotent quotient G/N?

E. I. Khukhro
